actions: Tonifies Spleen, Stomach and Heart Qi and calms the Spirit.
With Shi Chang Pu and Fu Shen, for confusion and forgetfulness.
Nourishes Heart Yin, tonifies Liver Blood and calms the Spirit.
Strengthens the Spleen, harmonizes the Middle Jiao, quiets the Heart, calms the Spirit and soothes the nerve.
Dries Dampness, transforms Phlegm, descends Rebellious Qi and harmonizes the Stomach.
Opens the Orifices, vaporizes Phlegm, removes filth, calms the Spirit, transforms turbid Dampness, harmonizes the Middle Jiao, awakens the Spleen and promotes the movement of Qi.
Regulates Qi, adjusts the Middle, descends Qi, relieves the diaphragm, dries Dampness and transforms Phlegm.
With Zhi Ban Xia, for a stifling sensation in the chest and cough with excessive white, viscous sputum due to Phlegm-Damp Obstruction.
Reduces Food Stagnation, promotes digestion, moves Qi and harmonizes the Stomach.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, resolves Phlegm, moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels.
Warms Ming Men Fire and assists Heart, Kidney and Spleen Yang.

symptoms: Sound of phlegm in throat with gurgling
Alternating sorrow and joy for no reason
Lack of discrimination between good and bad
Severe: Lack of sensitivity Inability to manage ones activities
